title: Merseyside Ukip chairmen quit in protest over Paul Nuttal's Hillsborough comments
text:
News Merseyside Ukip chairmen quit in protest over Paul Nuttal's Hillsborough comments Stuart Monkcom - chair of the Ukip leader's own branch - and Adam Heatherington said the handling of the row had been "crass" and "insensitive" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Emotional Paul Nuttall talks about Hillsbrough Share this video Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Two Merseyside Ukip officials have resigned over leader Paul Nuttall’s “crass” and “insensitive” comments about the Hillsborough disaster - including the chair of his own branch in Liverpool. 
In a joint statement, Liverpool Chairman Stuart Monkcom and Merseyside spokesman Adam Heatherington said the Ukip leader’s approach had been “upsetting and intolerable”. 
The Ukip leader was found to have published the false claim to have lost “close friends” in the tragedy on his website, which he blamed on a press officer. 
And he failed to condemn Arron Banks, a major Ukip donor who said he was “sick of hearing” about Hillsborough, accused people of “milking it” and called it an “accident”. Read More Nigel Farage defends his "good friend" Arron Banks's right to free speech despite Ukip donor's Hillsborough slurs 
In a statement, Mr Monkcom wrote: “Although the timing of our resignations is unfortunate in light of upcoming elections, both Adam and I wish to make it clear, where the painful subject of Hillsborough is concerned, with closure not yet in sight, this unprofessional approach and crass insensitivity from high profile people closely within and without Ukip is upsetting and intolerable. (Photo: REUTERS) 
“We identify most strongly with all the good people of Liverpool and most importantly the families of the Hillsborough victims who have fought so hard and long for justice, in their condemnation of the way Ukip has handled these issues and have resigned our positions and membership of Ukip forthwith." Read More UKIP's Paul Nuttall WEEPS on stage as he asks for support over false Hillsborough claims at party conference 
It's thought more resignations from Ukip's Merseyside branches are to follow. 
The Mirror approached Ukip for a statement, but they were, at the time, unable to confirm the resignations or the names of the party's chairs in Merseyside. They had not provided a statement at the time of publication. Paul Nuttall (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Liverpool fans at Hillsborough (Photo: PA) 
Shamed Nuttall wept on stage as he turned to his own members for support over false claims about Hillsborough . 
The UKIP leader brushed aside a tear after he left the bitter Stoke Central by-election campaign to address his party's spring conference 55 miles away - where he dodged reporters' questions and was bundled out a side door. 
In his speech, written during a hustings he skipped on Thursday, Mr Nuttall apologised and said he “takes the blame” for his website twice claiming he lost close friends in the stadium disaster. 
But he then launched into a defiant rant against the “lies” and “smear campaign” that suggested he wasn't at the 1989 tragedy, storming: “I will not allow them to break me.” 
And the self-professed Liverpool fan ducked a barrage of questions including about millionaire donor Arron Banks, who on Tuesday claimed people are "milking" Hillsborough and “accidents happen”. Read More
